t: Job 38
The Lord Reveals His Omnipotence to Job
Then*p the Lord*s answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said:
“Who*pn is*i this who darkens counsel By*ld words without knowledge?
Now*ld prepare yourself like a man; I*ld will question you, and you shall answer Me.
“Where*ln were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Tell*ld Me,*i if you have understanding.
Who*ld determined its measurements? Surely*ld you know! Or*ld who stretched the line upon it?
To*ld what were its foundations fastened? Or*ld who laid its cornerstone,
When*ld the morning stars sang together, And*ld all the sons of God shouted for joy?
“Or*ln who*i shut in the sea with doors, When*ld it burst forth and*i issued from the womb;
When*ld I made the clouds its garment, And*ld thick darkness its swaddling band;
When*ld I fixed My limit for it, And*ld set bars and doors;
When*ld I said, ‘This*ld far you may come, but no farther, And*ld here your proud waves must stop!’
“Have*ln you commanded the morning since your days began,*i And*ild caused the dawn to know its place,
That*ld it might take hold of the ends of the earth, And*ld the wicked be shaken out of it?
It*ld takes on form like clay under*i a seal, And*ld stands out like a garment.
From*ld the wicked their light is withheld, And*ld the upraised arm is broken.
“Have*ln you entered the springs of the sea? Or*ld have you walked in search of the depths?
Have*ld the gates of death been revealed to you? Or*ld have you seen the doors of the shadow of death?
Have*ld you comprehended the breadth of the earth? Tell*ld Me,*i if you know all this.
“Where*ln is*i the way to*i the dwelling of light? And*ld darkness, where is*i its place,
That*ld you may take it to its territory, That*ld you may know the paths to*i its home?
Do*ld you know it,*i because you were born then, Or*ld because*i the number of your days is*i great?
“Have*ln you entered the treasury of snow, Or*ld have you seen the treasury of hail,
Which*ld I have reserved for the time of trouble, For*ld the day of battle and war?
By*ld what way is light diffused, Or*ild the east wind scattered over the earth?
“Who*ln has divided a channel for the overflowing water,*i Or*ld a path for the thunderbolt,
To*ld cause it to rain on a land where*i there*i is*i no one, A*ld wilderness in which there*i is*i no man;
To*ld satisfy the desolate waste, And*ld cause to spring forth the growth of tender grass?
Has*ld the rain a father? Or*ld who has begotten the drops of dew?
From*ld whose womb comes the ice? And*ld the frost of heaven, who gives it birth?
The*ld waters harden like stone, And*ld the surface of the deep is frozen.
“Can*ln you bind the cluster of the Pleiades, Or*ld loose the belt of Orion?
Can*ld you bring out Mazzaroth in its season? Or*ld can you guide the Great Bear with its cubs?
Do*ld you know the ordinances of the heavens? Can*ld you set their dominion over the earth?
“Can*ln you lift up your voice to the clouds, That*ld an abundance of water may cover you?
Can*ld you send out lightnings, that they may go, And*ld say to you, ‘Here we are!’?*i
Who*ld has put wisdom in the mind? Or*ld who has given understanding to the heart?
Who*ld can number the clouds by wisdom? Or*ld who can pour out the bottles of heaven,
When*ld the dust hardens in clumps, And*ld the clods cling together?
“Can*ln you hunt the prey for the lion, Or*ld satisfy the appetite of the young lions,
When*ld they crouch in their*i dens, Or*ild lurk in their lairs to lie in wait?
Who*ld provides food for the raven, When*ld its young ones cry to God, And*ld wander about for lack of food?
